meanings.sent1: After a long day, I like to unstress by taking a warm bath.
meanings.sent2: She finds it helpful to unstress by listening to calming music.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to unstress by curling up in a sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: The gentle waves of the ocean have a way of unstressing the mind.
meanings.sent5: Inhaling the fresh air of the forest can truly unstress the soul.

meanings.definition: To make less tense or anxious.
meanings.sent1: Before the presentation, she needed to unstress by taking deep breaths.
meanings.sent2: He tried to unstress his friend by cracking a joke.
meanings.sent3: The funny movie managed to unstress everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The warm tea had a magical ability to unstress her nerves.
meanings.sent5: A good hug from a friend can instantly unstress a worried mind.
